commits.message:
Auto scaling zone rebalancing for configuration changes - EUCA-4995

Auto scaling availability zones are now rebalanced on configuration
change.

ActivityManager is updated to check if rebalancing is required whenever
a group requires scaling. The scaling required flag for a group is now
used to indicate rebalancing or capacity change is required.

AutoScaling group now exposes methods to update the desired capacity or
the availability zones to use. AutoScalingService uses these new methods
which ensure the scaling flag is set when necessary.

HealthStatus is updated to support use as a predicate for auto scaling
instances.

EUCA-4995

Auto scaling zone rebalancing for zone failures - EUCA-4995

Auto scaling availability zones are now rebalanced on failure or
recovery of a zone.

ActivityManager is updated to coordinate a persistent record of the
currently unavailable zones and to ignore unavailable zones when
launching instances.

AutoScalingGroups is updated to allow groups to be marked as requiring
scaling by zone, this is used when a zone state changes.

A new ZoneUnavailabilityMarker class is added to record unavailble zones
to the database. The ZoneUnavailabilityMarkers interface and
PersistenceZoneUnavailabilityMarkers implementation are added to manage
ZoneUnavailabilityMarker entities.

ZoneMonitor is added for in-memory tracking of zone availability. The
ZoneMonitorEventListener will periodically cause ZoneMonitor to process
zone availability.

EUCA-4995
